exceptions.tactic: pose proof (Nat.le_trans (alpha_nat n) (b_nat * alpha_nat (S n)) (b_nat * alpha_nat n) (alpha_nat_mono n (S n) (Nat.le_succ n))); apply Nat.mul_le_mono_l; apply Hb_nat.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
b_nat: nat
Hb_nat: 2 <= b_nat
n: nat

Goal:
alpha_nat n <= b_nat * alpha_nat (S n)

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
alpha_nat = fix alpha_nat (n : nat) : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | 1 => 1 | S (S r as p) => b_nat * alpha_nat p - alpha_nat r end : nat -> nat Arguments alpha_nat _%nat_scope
alpha_nat_fix_2 : forall n : nat, alpha_nat (S (S n)) = b_nat * alpha_nat (S n) - alpha_nat n
alpha_nat_inc : forall n : nat, alpha_nat n < alpha_nat (S n)
alpha_nat_2 : forall n : nat, b_nat = 2 -> alpha_nat n = n
alpha_nat_mono : forall i j : nat, i <= j -> alpha_nat i <= alpha_nat j
alpha_nat_ge_n : forall n : nat, n <= alpha_nat n
VectorDef.take : forall p : nat, p <= ?n -> VectorDef.t ?A ?n -> VectorDef.t ?A p where ?A : [b_nat : nat Hb_nat : 2 <= b_nat n : nat |- Type] ?n : [b_nat : nat Hb_nat : 2 <= b_nat n : nat |- nat]
alpha_nat_smono : forall i j : nat, i < j -> alpha_nat i < alpha_nat j
alpha_nat_fix_1 = eq_refl : alpha_nat 1 = 1
alpha_nat_fix_0 = eq_refl : alpha_nat 0 = 0
fact_S : forall n : nat, fact (S n) = S n * fact n
alpha_nat_gt_0 : forall n : nat, n <> 0 -> alpha_nat n <> 0
base_p_spec : forall (p : nat) (Hp : 2 <= p) (n : nat), n = expand p (base_p Hp n)
prime_bool_rec_spec : forall n p : nat, n <= p -> prime_bool_rec n p = true < -> (forall k : nat, 3 <= n - 2 * k -> ~ n - 2 * k │ p)
Nat2Z.inj_succ : forall n : nat, Z.of_nat (S n) = Z.succ (Z.of_nat n)
binomial_SS : forall n p : nat, binomial (S n) (S p) = binomial n p + binomial n (S p)
prime_algo : forall p : nat, prime p < -> p = 2 \/ 3 <= p /\ ~ 2 │ p /\ (forall n : nat, 3 + 2 * n < p -> ~ 3 + 2 * n │ p)
power_sinc : forall k p : nat, 2 <= p -> mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 k p < mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 (S k) p
power_S : forall n x : nat, mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 (S n) x = x * mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 n x
prime_or_div : forall p : nat, 2 <= p -> {q : nat | 2 <= q < p /\ q │ p} + {prime p}
divides_bool_spec' : forall n p : nat, divides_bool (S n) p = false < -> ~ S n │ p
Z2Nat.id : forall n : Z, (0 <= n)%Z -> Z.of_nat (Z.to_nat n) = n
VectorDef.cons : forall A : Type, A -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> VectorDef.t A (S n)
power_ge_n : forall k p : nat, 2 <= p -> k <= mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 k p
mult_le_compat : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n * p <= m * q
euclid_2 : forall n : nat, exists q : nat, n = 2 * q \/ n = 1 + 2 * q
Z.mul_le_mono_nonneg : forall n m p q : Z, (0 <= n)%Z -> (n <= m)%Z -> (0 <= p)%Z -> (p <= q)%Z -> (n * p <= m * q)%Z
Z.mul_nonneg_nonneg : forall n m : Z, (0 <= n)%Z -> (0 <= m)%Z -> (0 <= n * m)%Z
div_by_p_lt : forall p n : nat, 2 <= p -> n <> 0 -> div n p < n
base_p : forall p : nat, 2 <= p -> nat -> list nat
prime_factor : forall n : nat, 2 <= n -> {p : nat | prime p /\ p │ n}
Nat.le_wd = fun (n n' : nat) (Hn : n = n') (m m' : nat) (Hm : m = m') => (fun lemma : n < S m <-> n <= m => Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.iff_Transitive (n <= m) (n < S m) (RelationClasses.symmetry lemma) (n' <= m') (n' <= m') (Morphisms.eq_proper_proxy (n' <= m'))) (Nat.lt_succ_r n m) ((fun lemma : n' < S m' <-> n' <= m' => Morphisms.trans_sym_co_inv_impl_morphism (RelationClasses.Equivalence_PER RelationClasses.iff_equivalence) (n' <= m') (n' < S m') (RelationClasses.symmetry lemma)) (Nat.lt_succ_r n' m') ((fun lemma : n = n' => Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.iff_Transitive (n < S m) (n' < S m) (Nat.lt_wd n n' lemma (S m) (S m) (Morphisms.ref...
msum_S : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X) (n : nat) (f : nat -> X), msum m u (S n) f = m (f 0) (msum m u n (fun n0 : nat => f (S n0)))
msum_first_two : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> X), 2 <= n -> (forall i : nat, 2 <= i -> f i = u) -> msum m u n f = m (f 0) (f 1)
Wilson_theorem : forall p : nat, 2 <= p -> prime p < -> p │ fact (p - 1) + 1
utils_nat.pow2_dec_ge1 : forall p b : nat, 1 <= utils_nat.pow2 p * (2 * b + 1)
power_smono_l : forall p q x : nat, 2 <= x -> p < q -> mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 p x < mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 q x
Z2Nat.inj_le : forall n m : Z, (0 <= n)%Z -> (0 <= m)%Z -> (n <= m)%Z < -> Z.to_nat n <= Z.to_nat m
Nat.le_trans : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> m <= p -> n <= p
Inductive t (A : Type) : nat -> Type := nil : VectorDef.t A 0 | cons : A -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> VectorDef.t A (S n) Arguments VectorDef.t _%type_scope _%nat_scope Arguments VectorDef.nil _%type_scope Arguments VectorDef.cons _%type_scope _ _%nat_scope
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}

original: pose proof (Nat.le_trans (alpha_nat n) (b_nat * alpha_nat (S n)) (b_nat * alpha_nat n) (alpha_nat_mono n (S n) (Nat.le_succ n))); apply Nat.mul_le_mono_l; apply Hb_nat.
